sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"交谈"之意。
means: conversation ： 一般用词，指两个或更多人互相交换意见的交谈。
talk ： 普通用词，可与conversation换用，指正式交谈。
chat ： 指熟人之间非常随便的交谈，强调谈话的亲密和非正式性。

sentence.Network_en: You can chat to other people who are online.
sentence.Network_cn: 你可以和其他在线的人聊天。

sentence.Network_en: Whatever you want to chat about, we'll do it tonight.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你想聊些什么，我们今晚聊个够。

sentence.Network_en: I thought I'd, you know, have a chat with you.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想我应该，呃，和你谈谈。

jx.jx_en_mean: To engage (someone) in light, casual talk

lj.lj_ly: “He would be . . . chatting up folks from Kansas”(&b{Vanity Fair})
lj.lj_ls: “他总是在和美国堪萨斯州来的人搭讪”(&b{名利场})

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: probably imitative of its call

entry.def: When people chat, they talk to each other in an informal and friendly way.

example.ex: I was chatting to him the other day...
example.tran: 前几天我和他聊了一阵。

means.word_mean: 1. talk socially without exchanging too much information;

sentences.sentence: "the men were sitting in the cafe and shooting the breeze"

auth_sentence.content: Lindsay and Henry drop by to chat to Claudia.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lindsay and Henry drop by to chat to Claudia.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lindsay and Henry drop by to chat to Claudia.

auth_sentence.content: Lounge Chill, chat or just gather your thoughts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lounge Chill, chat or just gather your thoughts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lounge Chill, chat or just gather your thoughts.

auth_sentence.content: Hourly employees sometimes stop by his desk to chat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hourly employees sometimes stop by his desk to chat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hourly employees sometimes stop by his desk to chat.

Sentence.sentence: On the way home at night, I relax with a good book or chat with friends or even have a game of bridge.
They're online in chat rooms, checking e-mail, or writing blogs
too much time was spent in chat rooms
in one study, people who were instructed to think about money before entering a cafe spent less times chatting with the other patrons and more time working.

sentences.en: A boy and a girl are chatting charmingly together.
sentences.cn: 一个男孩和一个女孩正在娓娓交谈。

sentences.en: His friends tried to chat him back.
sentences.cn: 他的朋友们想劝他回来。

jushi.english: They were chatting in the corner.
We usually chat together for a while between classes.
jushi.chinese: 我们在课余往往闲谈一会儿。

jushi.english: My neighbor and I were chatting over the fence after supper.
jushi.chinese: 我和邻居晚饭后隔着栅栏闲聊。
